page.title: 16FARMING
page.content: The types of farm that are around Sidlesham are dairy farms, arable farms and a turkey farm. A typical farm which is a dairy and an arable farm is Chalder Farm. 10 people work there full time. 6 work on the dairy herd, 2 work on the nursery, 1 works on maintenance and 1 is the Head Tractor Driver. There are also three part-time ladies. One is a secretary, one rears calves and one works on the nursery. At certain times of the year there are also some casual workers. Highleigh Farm is a Turkey Farm. Mr. Baker employs 22 people. They are processors, drivers and herdsmen. They have 10 acres of land where they rear the turkeys, also some come from other places. The poults are brought to the farm when they are one day old and kept until they are about 26 weeks old
